      • start

        public void start()
        Description copied from interface: SplashApp
        Application main-class overrides this method to start the system. See example above.
        Specified by:
        start in interface SplashApp

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        NOTE: you must call one of the welcome methods before you call start(). If you don't, the initial splash image will flash very quickly and then be gone. If you only want the initial splash image displayed, then simply call welcome() with no imageFiles argument(s). You can still provide a custom pause interval. 
         
 SplashAppMain app = new SplashAppMain();
 app.welcome();      // initial image only, default pause
 app.welcome(3500);  // initial image only, custom pause
 
 // initial image, plus two additional images, default pause
 app.welcome("images/credits.jpg", "images/java.png");

 // initial image, plus two additional images, custom pause
 app.welcome(3500, "images/credits.jpg", "images/java.png");
